8.10.19  10:32 pm   what's your opinion on wireless ear buds

      latency hasn't come down enough for it to be good enough for things requiring instant response to user actions. i.e. music production, or phone conversations, or any type of game where it's important to hear an instant sound response to something you did. they're awesome as long as you're just consuming audio tracks (listening to music, not interacting with it) because once the song starts (half second late) it doesn't matter if the whole song is a half second late. Even video watching is ok, because most video players are smart enough to buffer it right so the vid syncs right with the audio. But if you're recording music, you're still looking at at least a 200ms latency. can't play an instrument that way. And this is not good for intimate phone calls either, because as it is, in the digital world, all cell phone calls have about half second delay (or more) already. And this gets worse when you're doing international, or internet calling. wireless ear phones will add at least quarter second delay on top of that. however, besides all that, it is truly awesome to have no wires. but i'd say the latency probably isn't down enough to discontinue the headphone jack just yet

8.10.19  9:41 pm   a very long time ago, i said something along the lines of, "i'm beginning to think that minor thirds are a very important interval. as in, maybe The Most important." and responded something like, "i see what you mean but you may discover that major seconds are more important." and my idea was--look at the minor thirds in a chord to see where it wants to resolve and how badly. Fm6 wants to resolve to C, G7 and G7b9 want to resolve to C, or to Cm, or if you get sneaky they might go to Am or A, or even F# in some cases. and you look at the common notes here: D, F, Ab, B like to go to chords with their root on C, Eb, F#, A. and a lot of things can be explained by this pattern of minor third series.

     true

      so i thought about your answer and how maybe it could fill some holes in my theory, like how Gsus4 likes to go to G, or how Eaug7 likes to go to E7 before it goes to Am, but ultimately i do not understand why what you said would be true. i know it was a long t ime ago but if you could explain why you might have said that i would appreciate the closure

     in your first question you didn't give any specifics, you just said ' i think major 3rds might be like the most important thing in the world' . And i believed you, but also true is things like wheels, tables, apples, and so on, could also be similarly thought of as 'the greatest thing in the world'. and probably to have a nice good world you'd probably need a little bit of them all. What you just gave above is wonderful. this has nothing to do with what i had in mind about major seconds being so useful. Melodies come to mind, when thinking about how 'important' major seconds are. And actually, when you first said 'wow major thirds are like really important', my mind immediately went to melodies (you didn't specify what you really meant, like you didn't specify that you were talking about harmonic resolutions, etc) so yeah, i sort of had to guess what you were talking about, and my mind went to melodies. in which case i think it's easy to see why min 3rds and maj 2nds together are hugely important for that game. maj2nds being an absolutely essential building block of anyone's melody kit
